Package org.apache.tamaya

Interface Configuration

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ConfigurationSnapshot
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CoreConfiguration, DefaultConfiguration, DefaultConfigurationSnapshot
    public interface Configuration

    A configuration models an aggregated setPropertyValue of current properties, identified by a unique key, but adds higher level access functions to a PropertySource. Hereby in most cases a configuration is a wrapper around a composite PropertySource instance, which may combine multiple child configurations in a well defined tree like structure, where nodes define logically the rules' current priority, filtering, combination and overriding.

    Implementation Requirements

    Implementations of this interface must be
    • Thread safe
    • Immutable

    It is not recommended that implementations also are serializable, since the any configuration can be frozen by reading out its complete configuration mapProperties into a serializable and remotable structure. This helps significantly by simplifying the development of this interface, e.g. for being backed up by systems and stores that are not part of this library at all.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static Configuration EMPTY
      Immutable and reusable, thread-safe implementation of an empty propertySource.

      • getOrDefault

        default <T> T getOrDefault​(String key,
                           Class<T> type,
                           T defaultValue)
        Gets the property keys as type T. This will implicitly require a corresponding PropertyConverter to be available that is capable of providing type T fromMap for the given String keys.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the class modeled by the type parameter
        Parameters:
        key - the property's absolute, or relative path, e.g. a/b/c/d.myProperty, not null.
        type - The target type required, not null.
        defaultValue - value to be used, if no value is present, not null
        Returns:
        the property value, never null.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the keys could not be converted to the required target type.

      • getOrDefault

        default <T> T getOrDefault​(Iterable<String> keys,
                           Class<T> type,
                           T defaultValue)
        Gets the property keys as type T. This will implicitly require a corresponding PropertyConverter to be available that is capable of providing type T fromMap for the given String keys.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the class modeled by the type parameter
        Parameters:
        keys - the property's keys, in evaluation order, not null.
        type - The target type required, not null.
        defaultValue - value to be used, if no value is present, not null
        Returns:
        the property value, never null.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the keys could not be converted to the required target type.

        default <T> T get​(String key,

        Gets the property keys as type T. This will implicitly require a corresponding PropertyConverter to be available that is capable of providing type T fromMap for the given String keys.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the class modeled by the type parameter
        Parameters:
        key - the property's absolute, or relative path, e.g. @code a/b/c/d.myProperty}.
        type - The target type required, not null.
        Returns:
        the property value, never null.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the keys could not be converted to the required target type.

      • get

        <T> T get​(String key,
          TypeLiteral<T> type)
        Get the property keys as type T. This will implicitly require a corresponding PropertyConverter to be available that is capable of providing type T literals for the given key.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the type literal
        Parameters:
        key - the property's absolute, or relative path, e.g. @code a/b/c/d.myProperty}, not null.
        type - The target type required, not null.
        Returns:
        the property value, never null.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the keys could not be converted to the required target type.

      • getOrDefault

        <T> T getOrDefault​(String key,
                   TypeLiteral<T> type,
                   T defaultValue)
        Get the property keys as type T. This will implicitly require a corresponding PropertyConverter to be available that is capable of providing type T literals for the given key.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the type literal
        Parameters:
        key - the property's absolute, or relative path, e.g. a/b/c/d.myProperty, not null.
        type - The target type required, not null.
        defaultValue - default value to be used, if no value is present.
        Returns:
        the property value, never null.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the keys could not be converted to the required target type.

      • getProperties

        Map<String,​String> getProperties()
        Access all currently known configuration properties as a full Map<String,String>. Be aware that entries from non scannable parts of the registered PropertySource instances may not be contained in the result, but nevertheless be accessible by calling one of the current(...) methods.
        Returns:
        all currently known configuration properties.

      • with

        @Deprecated
default Configuration with​(ConfigOperator operator)
        Deprecated.
        use map(UnaryOperator)
        Extension point for adjusting configuration.
        Parameters:
        operator - A configuration operator, e.g. a filter, or an adjuster combining configurations, never null.
        Returns:
        the new adjusted configuration returned by the operator, never null.

      • map

        default Configuration map​(UnaryOperator<Configuration> operator)
        Extension point for adjusting configuration.
        Parameters:
        operator - A configuration operator, e.g. a filter, or an adjuster combining configurations, never null.
        Returns:
        the new adjusted configuration returned by the operator, never null.

      • getSnapshot

        ConfigurationSnapshot getSnapshot​(Iterable<String> keys)
        Create a snapshot, which contains the given keys.
        Parameters:
        keys - the keys, not null. If empty a full snapshot with all known keys is returned.
        Returns:
        a corresponding snapshot instance.

      • getSnapshot

        default ConfigurationSnapshot getSnapshot​(String... keys)
        Create a snapshot, which contains all known keys.
        Parameters:
        keys - the target key. If empty a full snapshot with all known keys is returned.
        Returns:
        a corresponding snapshot instance.

      • toBuilder

        default ConfigurationBuilder toBuilder()
        Create a new builder using this instance as its base.
        Returns:
        a new builder, never null.

      • setCurrent

        static void setCurrent​(Configuration config)
        This method allows replacement of the current default Configuration with a new instance. It is the responsibility of the ConfigurationProvider to trigger corresponding update events for the current Configuration, so observing listeners can do whatever is appropriate to react to any given configuration change.
        Parameters:
        config - the new Configuration to be applied, not null
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the current provider is read-only and does not support applying a new Configuration.

      • setCurrent

        static void setCurrent​(Configuration config,
                       ClassLoader classLoader)
        This method allows replacement of the current default Configuration with a new instance. It is the responsibility of the ConfigurationProvider to trigger corresponding update events for the current Configuration, so observing listeners can do whatever is appropriate to react to any given configuration change.
        Parameters:
        config - the new Configuration to be applied, not null
        classLoader - the target classloader, not null.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the current provider is read-only and does not support applying a new Configuration.

      • current

        static Configuration current()
        Access the configuration instance for the current thread's context classloader.
        Returns:
        the configuration instance, never null.

      • current

        static Configuration current​(ClassLoader classloader)
        Accesses the configuration for a given classloader.
        Parameters:
        classloader - the classloader, not null.
        Returns:
        the configuration instance, never null.

      • releaseConfiguration

        static Configuration releaseConfiguration​(ClassLoader classloader)
        Releases the configuration associated with the given classloader.
        Parameters:
        classloader - the classloader, not null.
        Returns:
        the released configuration, or null.

      • createConfigurationBuilder

        static ConfigurationBuilder createConfigurationBuilder()
        Access a new configuration builder initialized with the current thread's context classloader.
        Returns:
        the builder, never null.
